intro: Dyssodia jelskii, commonly known as the Jelskii's dyssodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and southern Russia. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, with a distinctive silvery or grayish underside. Dyssodia jelskii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
